issue.title: Asyncio.py incompatible with Python 3.7
issue.body:
#5891 introduced this file from an external repository, as it has a useful chunk of code, but it also includes code which is incompatible with Python 3.7
Line 14: from¬∑asyncio¬∑import¬∑async
Also on lower versions of python it triggers pycodestyle warning: W606 'async' and 'await' are reserved keywords starting with Python 3.7
Ideally we enhance moban to somehow deal with this, where we want a subset of a file from an external source.
Another alternative is to move this chunk of code into a separate package, which we only need for older versions of Python, and in the separate repo/package the history/attribution/copyright of the chunk of code can be shown clearly.

issue.title: [BUG] An unknown error occurred

Kernel: 5.0.17-300.fc30.x86_64
Command Run
$ coala --show-bears --filter-by language Java --show-details --json

Console Output

[WARNING][13:56:33] show_params parameter is deprecated
[ERROR][13:56:33] An unknown error occurred. This is a bug. We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact the developers for assistance. During execution of coala an exception was raised. This should never happen. When asked for, the following information may help investigating:
[INFO][13:56:33] Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala.py", line 87, in main
    args)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/output/ConsoleInteraction.py", line 1010, in show_bears

    yield from _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 431, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 439, in _iterencode

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 325, in _iterencode_list
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 438, in _iterencode

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/output/JSONEncoder.py", line 32, in default

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coala_utils/decorators.py", line 135, in get_public_members

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coala_utils/decorators.py", line 137, in <dictcomp>

issue.title: [BUG] --filter-by wrong section name throws exception
issue.body:
Command Run
$ coala --json --filter-by some_unknown_filter_that_doesnt_exist

Output
[ERROR][14:47:33] An unknown error occurred. This is a bug. We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact the developers for assistance. During execution of coala an exception was raised. This should never happen. When asked for, the following information may help investigating:
[INFO][14:47:33] Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 170, in run_coala
    filtered = apply_filters(filters, sections=all_sections)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/parsing/FilterHelper.py", line 81, in apply_filters
    items = applier(filter_name, filter_args, items)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/parsing/FilterHelper.py", line 101, in _apply_section_filter
    raise InvalidFilterException(filter_name)

coalib.parsing.InvalidFilterException.InvalidFilterException: 'some_unknown_filter_that_doesnt_exist' is an invalid filter. Available filters: can_detect, can_fix, language, section_tags


During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:


Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 174, in run_coala
    console_printer.print(ex)

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'print'

{
  "results": {}
}

Possible Solution
The proper error message must be shown indicating such a filter doesn't exist instead of throwing a raw error message.
InvalidFilterException exception is being correctly emitted by the bear, just need to catch it and show an error message.
difficulty/low

issue.title: Appveyor build fails
issue.body:
Appveyor build is failing due to the recent changes in coalib\misc\Asyncio.py in the commit 58b9f41 . It is due QuotesBear.
The build report is here
The snippet of error:
Executing section python...
**** QuotesBear [Section <empty> | Severity NORMAL] ****
!    ! You do not use the preferred quotation marks. Preferred mark: '
[----] c:\projects\coala\coalib\misc\Asyncio.py
[++++] c:\projects\coala\coalib\misc\Asyncio.py
[   1] """Asyncio backports for Python 3.4.3 compatibility."""
[   1] '""Asyncio backports for Python 3.4.3 compatibility.""'

area/ci difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: coala_main.py and other files exceed line length according to PEP8 standard
issue.body:
coala_main.py, coalib/core/Core.py, setup.py, and some other files exceed the line length limit according to PEP8 standard.
Some of them can possibly be solved by adjusting the imports and docstrings.

issue.title: Setting.py: Change property name
issue.body:
The line_number property for Setting class should be changed to start_line_number as it is the starting line number of a setting.
difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: Writing_Linter_Bears.rst : Comma typo
issue.body:
In the Writing_Linter_Bears.rst file, in the line 54 , a comma should be added before the word pylint,
that is, the line:
As you can see ``pylint`` is already provided as an executable name which gets
should be changed to
As you can see, ``pylint`` is already provided as an executable name which gets
A difficulty/newcomer issue.

issue.title: Add language for SASS
issue.body: Like coalib/bearlib/languages/definitions/CSS.py

issue.title: LocalBearTestHelper.execute_bear: Remove final return statement
issue.body:
There is a yield in line 47 and a return in line 54. As long as the try block doesn't encounter an error, both are reached.
Sonarcube counts this as a breaking bug.

individually. It is not sufficient to have "fixup commits" on your PR,

comments.bodyText:
Hi @ojasgulati Looks like your editor has done auto-formatting of the files. Please take a look at the settings and try to push only the required changes.
We won't be able merge the PR until you revert the auto-formatted changes. As maintainers are busy, which is causing the invites to the contributors tool late. I can understand that you want to contribute and waiting for invitation. But you've to wait for some more time. For now, you can push the correct files with changes making sure that no files are being auto-formatted by your editor. Later on once you receive the invitation, we can look forward to merge it. And, if you interested in solving any other issue please don't create a PR for it until its been assigned to you. Maybe other contributors have already solved it. So, please take of this thing in future to avoid such happenings. And, since you have opened this PR let it be open, don't close it. But take care in future üòá Enjoy learning + coding üëç

@kushthedude @KVGarg Sorry for the late reply and also for not assigning myself to issue first, I will keep this in mind üòÖ. I was busy with some other work. I will make changes as mentioned.
Cheers üòÉ
Sure

comments.bodyText:
@hiteshsubnani0128 This is not the way Open Source works , I don't know is you have been in a proper organisation or not , you need to follow contribution guidelines before blindly making a PR , Please close the PR and follow the coala guidelines before making any contribution .
Hope i am clear to you. .
@KVGarg may provide more insight

Hi @kushthedude Sorry, but I think it was a little bit rude. I can understand your state/wordings that you're trying to convey to other contributors, but won't it be good to say this in a polite manner? I hope you're understanding me! Can you please take of this from next time? It's good that you're reviewing the merge requests and coala appreciate your review-work, but coala warns users who create merge requests for first time without getting assigned on that issue. If the user still not takes that warning seriously, then we have to take a strict action against him.
Since @hiteshsubnani0128 is a first-time contributor, so we (or you) should give a warning that to not to create a PR w/o getting assigned on issue. And, since you've created it its' ok and please take care to not to create a PR until assigned on the issue. And, mostly first-time contributors don't have an idea about commit guidelines so we should address them to follow it.
And, its contributor duty also to read commit guidelines if not read before. Because whenever user is about to create a PR, the coala pre-defined commit message appears in which two tasks are to be completed by contributor - follow guidelines and to run coala on new changes.
So, try to give a warning to first-time contributors in a polite manner w/o asking them to close the PR. The ones who've read coala newcomers guide won't create PRs until assigned on issue, as they're familiar with it. The all thing which I've just said above are all given in the guide.

Also, you can add a review to the PR, that to not create a PR from master branch. This is also mentioned in newcomers guide.
So, try to review them by pointing them to follow commit guidelines, read newcomers guide, not to create PR from master branch and many more can be finded while reviewing a PR, instead of asking them to close it. I hope you're understanding my concern üòá üëç

issue.title: .misc/appveyor.yml: Add path matching workaround
issue.body:
Windows is case-insensitive and auto-renames the
files to lowercase while Linux files are case-sensitive.
As a result to fix the build failure, a workaround
is introduced in this commit.
Fixes #5985

comments.bodyText: Appveyor is having too many connection failures :(
Have a look at the build https://ci.appveyor.com/project/abhishalya/coala/builds/24858052 (same commit, on my fork).

I was using the sed command to introduce the change, considering it as a very bad approach to solve this problem, I have introduced a os-check on the Collector.py file. This hits the coverage though, to cover the change, I think we need to mock the output of the platform.system() and write all the tests again for Windows.
(soon to be) Irrelevant.

Not sure this is irrelevant.  I just did an ugly hack.
The analysis is good at least.   Im not sure about the solution in this PR.  Needs tests, etc :P
Yeah, tests are also getting ugly. Not sure how to handle os-specific things...
We can have OS specific tests, and there are OS specific coverage rules (see setup.cfg)
Hmm, what do you think about this solution then, if the tests, etc are prepared.

I havent tried to understand the problem yet, so I cant comment on a solution just yet.
I've suggested one workaround at #5985 (comment)
And note the bigger problem is #6028

due to missing syntax in them. This fixes
that problem by avoiding such installation.

comments.bodyText: this import needs to be after the standard library imports, as pip is not a part of the standard library
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,7 @@
 import datetime
 import locale
 import os
+import pip

comments.bodyText: this isnt relevant for this issue -- only check_unsupported.sh is executed on these old unsupported pythons which have old pip.  In there, the pip needs to be upgraded.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -109,6 +108,8 @@ before_script:
   # Restore the original requirements.txt
   - mv requirements.orig requirements.txt
   - python .misc/check_setuptools.py
+  - pip --version
+  - pip install --upgrade pip~=9.0

comments.bodyText: @jayvdb I know, but if you check the previous build, it was failing due to pip==9.0 being used. So, I added these two to check.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -109,6 +108,8 @@ before_script:
   # Restore the original requirements.txt
   - mv requirements.orig requirements.txt
   - python .misc/check_setuptools.py
+  - pip --version
+  - pip install --upgrade pip~=9.0

But I have no idea, why pip-9 wasn't getting installed on 3.4.3
can you pull this change out into a separate commit , and I'd like to see a build with only this commit so I can see if this solves the breakage.  if not, why not.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -50,7 +49,7 @@ jobs:
       <<: *disable_global
       stage: unsupported
       script: .misc/check_unsupported.sh
-    - python: 3.4.3
+    - python: 3.4.1

As I expected, the job is green after this fix.  Please make a separate PR for just that change, as that is what solves the issue and turns our CI for master green. (the min pip problem is a separate problem which doesnt need to be solved urgently)
The commit message should indicate that the bug is in my commit which dropped the minimum version but forgot to update .travis.yml

       script: .misc/check_unsupported.sh
-    - python: 3.4.3
+    - python: 3.4.1

comments.bodyText: Sorry, created the PR accidentally.
@jayvdb Have a look at this :)

@jayvdb I'm not sure why this is happening:
$ pip install --upgrade pip~=9.0
Collecting pip~=9.0
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/ac/95/a05b56bb975efa78d3557efa36acaf9cf5d2fd0ee0062060493687432e03/pip-9.0.3-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: pip
  Found existing installation: pip 7.1.2
    Uninstalling pip-7.1.2:
      Successfully uninstalled pip-7.1.2
Successfully installed pip-8.1.2

Let me know your thoughts on the changes :)
After running pip install, use pip list or pip --version to show what is installed, or even python -c 'import pip; print(pip.__version__)' to show what was installed.  Never trust pip.

Why it happening?  Maybe pip 9.x refuses to install into Python 3.4.3?
Or maybe there are multiple versions of pip installed.

Maybe pip 9.x refuses to install into Python 3.4.3?

I tried it locally, but pip~=9.0 installs well as expected.
@jayvdb Seems like its done now, I'll remove the travis unsupported job change once you approve. Also, the moban needs to be updated.
@abhishalya where is your change to the mobans templates?  Link to MR please.

@jayvdb Done as you asked https://gitlab.com/coala/mobans/merge_requests/127, I'm not familiar with moban that much, so maybe I might've made mistake. Apologies for that.
Also, I've created a separate commit for the travis change, the build with just that commit can be seen here: https://travis-ci.org/abhishalya/coala/builds/537371787
Great job.  Now we need this rebased, and a moban sync done.

issue.title: LocalBearTestHelper.py: Add base directory argument
issue.body:
This adds an optional argument base_directory to verify_local_bear
function.
Closes #5895

For short term contributors: we understand that getting your commits well
defined like we require is a hard task and takes some learning. If you
look to help without wanting to contribute long term there's no need
for you to learn this. Just drop us a message and we'll take care of brushing
up your stuff for merge!
Checklist

 I read the commit guidelines and I've followed
them.
 I ran coala over my code locally. (All commits have to pass
individually. It is not sufficient to have "fixup commits" on your PR,
our bot will still report the issues for the previous commit.) You will
likely receive a lot of bot comments and build failures if coala does not
pass on every single commit!

After you submit your pull request, DO NOT click the 'Update Branch' button.
When asked for a rebase, consult coala.io/rebase
instead.
Please consider helping us by reviewing other peoples pull requests as well:

pick up any PR at https://coala.io/review
review it (check https://coala.io/reviewing for more info)
if you are sure that it needs work, use corobo mark wip <URL> to get it out
of the review queue.

The more you review, the more your score will grow at coala.io and we will
review your PRs faster!

comments.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
            
          
        
      
    
    
      
        
          
              :param base_directory:   Path to base directory. Change to base_directory
        
          
            
                :param base_directory:   Path to the base directory. Changes the CWD to base_directory
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -370,6 +371,8 @@ def verify_local_bear(bear,
     :param timeout:          Unused.  Use pytest-timeout or similar.
     :param tempfile_kwargs:  Kwargs passed to tempfile.mkstemp() if tempfile
                              needs to be created.
+    :param base_directory:   Path to base directory. Change to base_directory

comments.diffHunk:

         ]),
     settings={'max_line_length': 20},
 )
+ChangeBaseDirectoryTest = verify_local_bear(TestBear,
+                                            valid_files=files,
+                                            invalid_files=(),
+                                            settings={'result': True},
+                                            base_directory='tests/bears'

comments.bodyText:
This test doesn't seem thorough. You're supposed to test if the directory is actually changing when you supply base_directory so I'd suggest mocking change_directory and testing if it is called with the right arguments and the right number of times.
I recommend consulting one other reviewer though.
Yeah, this doesn't test the working of the changes made. Since even if base_directory isin't provided the test would pass.

Yeah Agreeing with both the reviewers above you could try mocking change_directory, or if you are not familiar with mocking you could follow the assert,check and test method and see if you are able to solve the issue.

@frextrite I tested the function change_directory externally and realized it uses the Context Manager, so I wrapped it within a with statement. Can you give me a hint on how to implement tests? I mean is there any test bear which requires directory change?
You can take a look and see how the other functions in this file have been tested. I don't think a bear is required for testing purposes since it should be mocked anyway.
@123vivekr  have you tried to run the script  on your local system?

@Dhiraj240

This is the only error shown when I run python setup.py test
I have updated pip using the command but still the error persists. A google search says async has been added as a keyword from the latest versions.
Also I don't see any errors in TravisCI except for only 99.89% code coverage.
@123vivekr Okay ideally it should be 100% it does need changes. Does  python localbeartesthelpertest.py working ? Can you show me the screenshot of that one.
what could be the reason for  no module tests.test_bears  ? should we avoid it ?
@areebbeigh I didn't notice that. Thanks for your help :) Changes have been made and Travis CI tests are passing
Please run coala or use an editor like vscode with all the liners enabled.
Please don't push without making sure of the above comment. Are you running coala!?
I have run coala before pushing. It doesn't show any autopep8 errors now

Also, running python setup.py test doesn't give any other error on my local system. But TravisCI shows error
Local System python version: 3.7.2
@123vivekr Are these two commits different to each other if not then kindly squash those commits.Cheers

@123vivekr Are these two commits different to each other if not then kindly squash those commits.Cheers

The first commit is the solution to the issue and the second one is the tests for the same. Currently the tests are failing. I'll squash once the fix is complete.
Yeahüî• no problem :)

+        'address', 'bool', 'break', 'byte',

comments.bodyText: Add a newline at the end
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+from coalib.bearlib.languages.Language import Language
+
+
+@Language
+class Solidity:
+    extensions = '.sol'
+    comment_delimiters = '//',
+    string_delimiters = {'"': '"'}
+    multiline_string_delimiters = {}
+    indent_types = {'{': '}'}
+    keywords = [
+        'address', 'bool', 'break', 'byte',
+        'const', 'continue', 'do', 'else',
+        'emit', 'enum', 'false', 'float',
+        'for', 'function', 'goto', 'if',
+        'int', 'long', 'pragma', 'return',
+        'string', 'struct', 'throw', 'true',
+        'uint', 'while']
